Title: Nanostructured photoconductive terahertz detector for near-field microscopy
Source: Int. Conf. Infrared, Millim., Terahertz Waves, IRMMW-THz
Abstract: © 2016 IEEE.We demonstrate that a nanostructured terahertz (THz) photoconductive detector enables sampling of THz fields localized on micrometer scale. The nanostructure, consisting of an optical nanoantenna array and a distributed Bragg reflector, acts as a hybrid cavity, which traps optical gate pulses within an optically thin photoconductive layer of the THz detector. This allows us to detect highly confined (<1 μm) evanescent THz fields. By monolithically integrating this THz detector with apertures ranging from 2 μm to 5 μm we achieve higher spatial resolution and higher sensitivity in aperture-type THz near-field microscopy and THz time-domain spectroscopy.
